intro: Conostylis tomentosa, commonly known as the woolly conostylis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a member of the Goodeniaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, woolly foliage. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in open habitats. Conostylis tomentosa is often found in coastal and inland regions of southern Australia.
